noun.description: A portable shelter made of cloth, supported by one or more poles and stretched tight by cords or loops attached to pegs driven into the ground.

verb.description: Cover with or as if with a tent.
examples: the garden had been completely tented over for supper

verb.description: (especially of traveling circus people) live in a tent.

origin: Late Middle English (also denoting a surgical probe): from Old French tente, from tenter to probe, from Latin temptare handle, test, try.
